id: Creedence Clearwater Collective-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Creedence Clearwater Collective
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Take a walk back in time to enjoy some of the most famous music of the 60s and 70s.
Creedence Clearwater Revival was a juggernaut of phenomenal proportions.
From their album debut in 1968 to their last album in 1972 the band produced some highly memorable songs.
Many of them are still regularly played today.
The Creedence Clearwater Collective recreates the success of the original band.

id: Kaylee Bell — Cowboy Up Tour-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Kaylee Bell — Cowboy Up Tour
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Wellington will be getting its ‘yeehaw’ on for a much-anticipated concert this November.
New Zealand country-pop force Kaylee Bell rides into town to set up at the Michael Fowler Centre.
Fans can expect a full-throttle live show featuring hits from her three studio albums, the most recent being ‘Nights Like This’ released in 2023.
Have a listen out for viral, banjo-infused hits like Cowboy Up, Red Dirt Romeo, Boots N’ All, and Good Things.
As part of a five-city tour of the country this is her biggest headline show to date.

id: Queen: It’s a Kinda Magic-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Queen: It’s a Kinda Magic
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
To celebrate the anniversary of the British band Queen’s famous song, a tribute act is touring and stopping in Wellington.
Think big sound, big screens, crazy lighting, and outlandish costumes.
Dominic Warren will take the lead performing lead vocals, guitar and piano.
All songs are in Freddie’s original key.
Get ready to mosh to ‘We Will Rock You,’ ‘We Are the Champions,’ ‘Radio Ga Ga,’ ‘I Want to Break Free,’ ‘Somebody to Love,’ ‘Don’t Stop Me Now,’ ‘Another One Bites the Dust,’ ‘A Kind of Magic,’ and of course, ‘Bohemian Rhapsody.’

id: Bill Bailey — Vaudevillean-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Bill Bailey — Vaudevillean
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
It’s a celebration of comedy, songs, and multifarious skills.
Bill Bailey Vaudevillian is a wild ride through the lost art of vaudeville.
Before streaming, before TV, before cinema, even before radio, there was vaudeville.
A theatrical tradition invented mid-19th century in France, vaudeville was a type of variety show.
It might have included popular and classical musicians, singers, dancers, magicians, ventriloquists, strongmen, impersonators, or clowns.

id: The Bruce Springsteen Experience-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: The Bruce Springsteen Experience
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Relive some of the best anthems of the 80s and 90s.
The Bruce Springsteen Experience is a show dedicated to honouring the timeless music of Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band.
Featuring a nine-piece band, this electrifying performance will deliver a brilliant blend of live music and visuals.
2025 marks the 50th anniversary of the release of Bruce’s iconic album ‘Born to Run’.
This tribute concert will perform the album in its entirety, along with a selection of The Boss’s greatest hits.

id: Coal Miner’s Daughter-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Coal Miner’s Daughter
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
American country music singer and songwriter Loretta Lynn had a career spanning six decades.
Audiences will be captivated by brilliant storytelling and performances.
Follow Loretta Lynn’s life from her early days in the hills of Kentucky to a tempestuous marriage, and massive music-world success.
Among her friends were artists Patsy Cline, Conway Twitty, Tammy Wynette, Dolly Parton, and Willie Nelson.
Hear I Fall To Pieces, You Ain’t Woman Enough To Take My Man, Crazy, Walkin’ After Midnight, Stand By Your Man, After The Fire Is Gone, and more.

id: Paul Kelly-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Paul Kelly
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
The Australian has written and sung a superb catalogue of love songs spanning more than 40 years.
He’s heading to Wellington’s Michael Fowler Centre to share his music.
The tour will come a few months after the release of his next studio album ‘Fever Longing Still’.
Joining Paul on stage is his band, who help bring these new songs to life.
The album title comes from a line in ‘Sonnet 147’ by Shakespeare, whose writing has thrilled and inspired Paul ever since his school days.

id: Kirk Franklin — The World Tour-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Kirk Franklin — The World Tour
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
He’s considered a transformative force in contemporary gospel music.
Kirk Franklin is a trailblazer in his field, and he’s sharing his talents with a Wellington audience.
The 20-time Grammy Award-winning gospel artist has a unique sound that resonates across generations.
That release featured the number one hit single All Things which earned him Grammy number 20 in 2024.
In 2025, he released the soul-stirring new single Do It Again which quickly connected with audiences.

id: Mamma Mia!-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Mamma Mia!
venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Gimme, gimme, gimme a night of song and dance.
Mamma Mia is the ultimate feel-good show.
The stage musical has been wowing audiences since 1999.
It’s due to wow Wellington audiences in 2025.
Get ready to tap your toe to some of ABBA’s most famous songs.

id: Jimmy Carr: Laughs Funny-TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Jimmy Carr: Laughs Funny
description:
Jimmy Carr: Laughs Funny will bring the comedian’s signature dark brand of humour to TSB Arena.
The presenter, actor, and writer is known for his one-liners, rapid-fire delivery, and signature laugh.
His content is often described as “edgy”, so be prepared for a raised eyebrow or two.
Just like a magnet, it attracts some people and repels others.
For those who are attracted to risqué jokes with a bit of spice, this is a show not to miss.

id: Rob Beckett — Giraffe-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Rob Beckett — Giraffe
venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Since debuting as a stand-up comic in 2009, British funnyman Rob Beckett has built an impressive career.
From podcasts and radio to hosting, television, and voiceovers, Rob is a versatile comedian.
New Zealand audiences might recognise him as one of the winners of the popular show ‘Taskmaster’, or the long-running ‘8 Out of 10 Cats’.
He has many other UK television shows to his name including ‘Rob & Romesh Vs.’ and ‘Celebs Go Dating’.
Now a father of two, he has focused his lens on the ups and downs of parenting and produces a smash-hit podcast ‘Parenting Hell’.

id: Urzila Carlson — You Don’t Say-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Urzila Carlson — You Don’t Say
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
The trademark cheeky wit is back.
South African-Kiwi Urzila Carlson is heading to Wellington with a new show.
‘You Don’t Say’ continues to cement her reputation as an undeniable force in the comedy world.
Urzila recently presented this show at the Melbourne International Comedy Festival.
Talking about the upcoming tour she said, “It’s a show born out of sarcasm and storytelling from the mind of a woman who might be slightly out of her mind!” This year is huge for the comedy queen.

id: Kevin Bloody Wilson — Aussie Icon Tour-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Kevin Bloody Wilson — Aussie Icon Tour
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Now the outrageously funny (and outrageous) comedian is back.
Kevin Bloody Wilson — Aussie Icon Tour is set to roll into The Opera House in September.
He’ll perform a selection of his funniest songs, and irreverent stories — all infused with his wickedly rude sense of humour.
Kevin’s journey to politically incorrect stardom started in 1977.
He began by changing the words to other people’s songs, eventually writing some songs himself.

id: Luke Kidgell — Good Intentions-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Luke Kidgell — Good Intentions
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
You’ve seen him on the internet, now it’s time to see him in real life.
Luke Kidgell established a reputation as a social media star.
His YouTube content and podcasts cemented his comedic credentials.
Now, following a successful tour of the United States, Canada, Australia, and Europe, Luke is coming to Wellington.
This year, he’s on a mission to prove that he really does have good intentions.

id: GOMIL — Grumpy Old Man in Lycra-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: GOMIL — Grumpy Old Man in Lycra
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
You may have heard of the phenomenally popular stage show, ‘MAMIL – Middle Aged Man in Lycra’.
This one-man show stars Kiwi acting royalty Mark Hadlow of ’King Kong’ and ‘The Hobbit’ fame.
It’s sure to bring a fresh wave of laughter, Lycra, and life’s absurdities.
This show dives deep into the world of ageing men, fragile egos, friendship, and family.
‘Grumpy Old Man in Lycra’ is a celebration of growing older (and slightly wider) with humour, heart, and a healthy dose of spandex.
